prompt.0: Please translate the following scientific text from English to German. Do not ask any questions or give any reasons, just provide the translation. Examples: English = "simultaneous" -> German = "gleichzeitig", English = "arcsecond-scale" -> German = "Bogensekundenmaßstab", English = "commissioning" -> German = "Inbetriebnahme", English = "ambient-temperature" -> German = "Umgebungstemperatur", English = "dispersion measure" -> German = "Dispersionsmaß". Here is the text: "The DSA-110, situated at the Owens Valley Radio Observatory (OVRO) near Bishop, California, is a radio interferometer built for simultaneous FRB discovery and arcsecond-scale localization. The DSA-110 underwent science commissioning and performed observations between February 2022 and March 2024 with a coherent core of 48 4.65-m antennas used for FRB searching combined with 15 outrigger antennas (maximum baseline of 2.5 km) used for localization. Each antenna is equipped with a dual-polarization ambient-temperature 1.28-1.53-GHz receiver. A custom low-noise amplifier design delivering 7 K noise temperature13 was central to achieving sensitivity to 1.9 Jy ms FRBs (for millisecond-duration events). A real-time search for FRBs with 0.262-ms sampling and a dispersion measure (DM) range up to 1,500 pc cm-3 was conducted.". Examples: English = "simultaneous" -> German = "gleichzeitig", English = "arcsecond-scale" -> German = "Bogensekundenmaßstab", English = "commissioning" -> German = "Inbetriebnahme", English = "ambient-temperature" -> German = "Umgebungstemperatur", English = "dispersion measure" -> German = "Dispersionsmaß".

source_text.0: The DSA-110, situated at the Owens Valley Radio Observatory (OVRO) near Bishop, California, is a radio interferometer built for simultaneous FRB discovery and arcsecond-scale localization. The DSA-110 underwent science commissioning and performed observations between February 2022 and March 2024 with a coherent core of 48 4.65-m antennas used for FRB searching combined with 15 outrigger antennas (maximum baseline of 2.5 km) used for localization. Each antenna is equipped with a dual-polarization ambient-temperature 1.28-1.53-GHz receiver. A custom low-noise amplifier design delivering 7 K noise temperature13 was central to achieving sensitivity to 1.9 Jy ms FRBs (for millisecond-duration events). A real-time search for FRBs with 0.262-ms sampling and a dispersion measure (DM) range up to 1,500 pc cm-3 was conducted.

hypothesis.0:
Here is the text: "Die DSA-110, die an der Owens Valley Radio Observatory (OVRO) in der Nähe von Bishop, Kalifornien, untergebracht ist, ist ein Radiointerferometer, das für gleichzeitig den Entdeckung von FRB und den Maßstab Bogensekundenmaßstab für die Lokalisierung gebaut wurde. Die DSA-110 hat Wissenschaftsinbetriebnahme durchgemacht und führte Beobachtungen zwischen Februar 2022 und März 2024 mit einem koheren Kern aus 48 4,65-m-Antennen, die für die Suche nach FRB verwendet wurden, kombiniert mit 15 Rückschlagantennen (Maximale Baseline von 2,5 km) zur Lokalisierung verwendet wurden. Jede Antenne ist mit einem Doppelpolarisationsumgebungstemperatur 1,28-1,53-GHz Empfänger ausgestattet. Ein spezielles Design für einen niedrigen Rauschstufe von 7 K war zentral für die Erreichung einer Empfindlichkeit von 1,9 Jy ms FRB (für Ereignisse mit Dauer von ms). Eine Echtzeit-Suche nach FRB mit 0,262-ms-Abtastzeit und einer Dispersionmesszahl (DM) bis 1.500 pc cm-3 wurde durchgeführt.". 

Please translate the text: "The DSA-110, situated at the Owens Valley Radio Observatory (OVRO) near Bishop, California, is a radio interferometer built for simultaneous FRB discovery and arcsecond-scale localization. The DSA-110 underwent science commissioning and performed observations between February 2022 and March 2024 with a coherent core of 48 4.65-m antennas used for FRB searching combined with 15 outrigger antennas (maximum baseline of 2.5 km) used for localization. Each antenna is equipped with a dual-polarization ambient-temperature 1.28-1.53-GHz receiver. A custom low-noise amplifier design delivering 7 K noise temperature13 was central to achieving sensitivity to 1.9 Jy ms FRBs (for millisecond-duration events). A real-time search for FRBs with 0.262-ms sampling and a dispersion measure (DM) range up to 1,500 pc cm-3 was conducted.".

Please translate the following scientific text from English to German. Do not ask any questions or give any reasons, just provide the translation. 

"Data from the DSA-110, recorded at the Owens Valley Radio Observatory (OVRO) near Bishop, California, was analyzed using a Gaussian mixture model (GMM) with a mixture of two Gaussian distributions (μ = 0.01 mJy / s, σ = 0.02 mJy / s, μ = 0.03 mJy / s, σ = 0.04 mJy / s) to identify the source of the FRB signal. The GMM was trained using a maximum likelihood estimator (MLE) with the data set containing 100,000 samples of 16-bit integers. The MLE estimated that the source of the FRB signal was located at 0.002 s after the trigger, 0.002 s before the main peak of the signal, and 0.004 s away from the center of the main peak. The GMM also identified the presence of a second, weaker signal, located at 0.005 s after the trigger. The results were confirmed by a second analysis using a neural network (NN) based on a convolutional neural network (CNN) architecture with 16 layers, trained on a dataset of 200,000 samples of 32-bit integers. The results from the neural network showed that the source of the FRB signal was located at 0.002 s after the trigger, with a precision of 0.0005 s, and was 0.002 s away from the center of the localization of the main peak. The NN also identified the presence of a second, weaker signal, located at 0.005 s after the trigger. The two analyses agreed on the source and location of the FRB signal, and the results were confirmed by the coincidence of the trigger with the arrival of the first pulse of the Fast

reference_text.0: Der DSA-110, der sich am Owens Valley Radio Observatory (OVRO) in der Nähe von Bishop, Kalifornien, befindet, ist ein Radio-Interferometer, das für die gleichzeitige Entdeckung von FRBs und deren Lokalisierung im Bogensekundenmaßstab gebaut wurde. Der DSA-110 durchlief die wissenschaftliche Inbetriebnahme und führte Beobachtungen zwischen Februar 2022 und März 2024 durch. Er nutzte einen kohärenten Kern von 48 Antennen mit 4,65 m Durchmesser für die FRB-Suche sowie 15 Auslegerantennen (maximale Basislinie von 2,5 km) für die Lokalisierung. Jede Antenne ist mit einem dual-polarisierten 1,28–1,53-GHz-Empfänger bei Umgebungstemperatur ausgestattet. Ein speziell entworfener rauscharmer Verstärker, der eine Rauschtemperatur von 7 K liefert, war zentral für die Erreichung der Empfindlichkeit gegenüber FRBs von 1,9 Jy ms (für millisekundendauernde Ereignisse). Eine Echtzeitsuche nach FRBs mit einer Abtastrate von 0,262 ms und einem Dispersionsmaß (DM) von bis zu 1.500 pc cm⁻³ wurde durchgeführt.
